pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:0.5: 61. The training rule on pregnant women
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.2: the nuns gave the full admission to a pregnant woman.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.5: “Give almsfood to the Venerable. She’s carrying a heavy burden.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.7: “How can the nuns give the full admission to a pregnant woman?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.8: The nuns heard the complaints of those people
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.9: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.11: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.16: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.17.1: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a pregnant woman, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.6: a woman with child is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.9: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.10: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.11: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.12: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.13: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.1: If the woman is pregnant, and the nun perceives her as such, yet she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.2: If the woman is pregnant, but the nun is unsure of it, yet she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.3: If the woman is pregnant, but the nun does not perceive her as such, and she gives her the full admission, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.4: If the woman is not pregnant, but the nun perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.5: If the woman is not pregnant, but the nun is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.6: If the woman is not pregnant, and the nun does not perceive her as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.2: if she gives the full admission to a woman is pregnant, but she  does not perceive her as such;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.3: if she gives the full admission to a woman is not pregnant, and she does not perceive her as such;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.6: The first training rule is finished.
